In October, Sergio Marchionne ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy. Trade unions and politicians accused him of "blackmail" in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure. antiquities, Zahi Hawass , said that during the revolt several ancient treasures had been stolen from the Egyptian Museum, including a statue of the renowned boy king Tutankhamun. The objects missing from the famed museum include a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess and parts of another statue showing him harpooning, he said.
